UPDATED 8:40 AM PT – Monday, April 4, 2022
Top Biden administration officials have continued to fan the flames of the crisis at the southern border.
Despite the Biden administration’s ardent defense of the move, several Democrat lawmakers, including Senators Mark Kelly (D-Ariz.) and Joe Manchin (D-W.Va.) decried the move.
On Sunday, Secretary of State Antony Blinken defended the CDCs announcement last week that it would end the public health measure called Title 42 on May 23.
The measure was employed by both the Trump and Biden administrations amid the COVID-19 pandemic to turn away migrants at the border due to health concerns.
LA JOYA, TEXAS – JUNE 21: Medical personnel check in with immigrants after they crossed the Rio Grande into the U.S. on June 21, 2021 in La Joya, Texas.
A surge of mostly Central American immigrants crossing into the United States has challenged U.S. immigration agencies along the U.S. Southern border.
The DHS chief went on to claim border agents are well equipped to handle the surge and the agency will actually enforce deportation proceedings.
When asked about the potential downsides to lifting the measure, Blinken pivoted and rambled about the Biden administration’s policy goals.
This comes as U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials warn when Title 42 officially ends, there will be a mass migration event.
During an interview last week, Mayorkas tried to brush off the fact that border agents allegedly see around 7,000 migrants per day.
After pressure from progressive groups suing Biden over keeping the rule in place, it seems he has caved to their demands.
Gallagher is urging Congress to cancel its upcoming recess to pass measures that will secure the southern border.
